title: Yammy Nevliya bilingual (Hindi/English) world-famous recipes site with search, photos, and recipe management

requirements.text: Create a Motoko backend recipe data model and persistence for a single-canister app, storing bilingual fields and metadata for each recipe: id, titleEn, titleHi, descriptionEn, descriptionHi, ingredientsEn, ingredientsHi, stepsEn, stepsHi, cuisine, category, prepTimeMinutes, cookTimeMinutes, servings, photoAssetPath, createdAt.

quotes: Create a website thats name yammy nevliya, for food recipes that have world's most famous food recipes in hindi and english language and automatically added all type recipes with pic's

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to create, list, get-by-id, and search/filter recipes.
Recipe records persist across page refreshes/canister calls during runtime and are returned consistently by list/get APIs.
All fields listed in the requirement are represented in the backend type(s) and returned to the frontend.

requirements.text: Seed the backend with an initial set of world-famous recipes across multiple categories and cuisines (e.g., appetizers, main courses, desserts), ensuring every seeded recipe includes both English and Hindi content and a valid photoAssetPath that points to a frontend static asset.

quotes: world's most famous food recipes in hindi and english language ... with pic's

acceptanceCriteria: A fresh deploy includes a non-empty recipe list without requiring any user input.
Seeded recipes cover at least 3 categories and at least 3 cuisines.
Every seeded recipe has non-empty *En and *Hi fields and a photoAssetPath that resolves to an actual file in the frontend build.

requirements.text: Implement a bilingual UI for Yammy Nevliya with a global language toggle (Hindi/English) that switches all recipe content fields and key UI labels across the app.

quotes: have world's most famous food recipes in hindi and english language

acceptanceCriteria: A single language toggle is visible in the main header/navigation.
Toggling the language switches recipe titles, descriptions, ingredients, and steps between Hindi and English without reloading the page.
Key UI labels (navigation, search placeholder, form labels/buttons) change language consistently with the toggle.

requirements.text: Build the primary frontend pages and navigation for the recipe site: (1) Home/Explore page with search and filters (category and cuisine), (2) recipe list/grid showing photo + key metadata, and (3) recipe detail page showing photo, metadata, ingredients, and steps.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can navigate between an explore/list view and a recipe detail view.
Search filters the displayed recipes based on the currently selected language content.
Category and cuisine filters can be applied to narrow the list results.
Each recipe card shows an image, title, and at least category/cuisine and time/servings metadata.
Recipe detail page shows the recipe image, bilingual title/description, ingredients, steps, and metadata.

requirements.text: Add an in-app recipe creation form that allows adding new recipes without code changes, including all bilingual fields (English + Hindi), metadata fields, and selecting a photoAssetPath from available static assets.

quotes: automatically added all type recipes with pic's

acceptanceCriteria: A user can open a 'New Recipe' flow from the UI and submit a recipe.
Submitting creates the recipe in the backend and it appears in the list immediately after creation.
The form includes inputs for all required bilingual and metadata fields, and a controlled way to choose a photoAssetPath from known static assets.
Validation prevents submission when required fields are missing (at minimum: title, category, cuisine, and photoAssetPath).

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a food/recipe site (colors, typography, layout, and components) and enforce it consistently across the header, navigation, cards, filters, forms, and detail pages (avoid blue/purple as primary colors).

quotes: Create a website thats name yammy nevliya

acceptanceCriteria: UI styling is consistent across all pages and major components.
Theme uses a food-appropriate palette that does not rely on blue/purple as primary colors.
Layouts are responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (logo/hero and a small set of recipe photos) and render them in the UI for site branding and seeded recipes via photoAssetPath.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend (not proxied through the backend).
The header/landing area displays the generated logo and/or hero image.
Seeded recipes display the generated recipe photos correctly in list and detail views.

constraints: Use React + TypeScript + Tailwind + Shadcn UI + React Query for the frontend.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if state upgrade requires it.
Do not add third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is allowed if authentication is needed (not required here).
nonGoals: Automatically importing recipes from external websites/APIs (no scraping or third-party ingestion).
User accounts, favorites, ratings, comments, or social/sharing features.
Image upload pipeline through the backend; images should be static frontend assets referenced by path.

Simple flat logo mark for a recipe brand, warm color palette (yammy-nevliya-logo.dim_512x512.png)
